intro: Acosta jurineifolia, commonly known as the Jurineifolia Acosta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
